content: Welcome to Tong Xu's HomePage Tong Xu Ph.D, Professor School of Computer Science University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) Email: tongxu AT ustc.edu.cn Room 207, Science and Technology Laboratory Building, West Campus, USTC, Hefei, Anhui, China, 230027 Tong Xu is a Professor at USTC, China. He received the Ph.D degree of Computer Science in Jul. 2016 under the supervision of Prof. Enhong Chen. Before that, he once stayed as a visiting student co-supervised by Prof. Hui Xiong at Management Science and Information Systems Department of Rutgers, the State University of New Jersey. His research interests include Social Media Analysis, Multimodal Intelligence and other data mining related techniques. Currently, Tong serves as a senior member of China Computer Federation, and the director of Youth Working Committee for CIPS. Education Sep. 2010 ~ Jul. 2016 Ph.D Student, School of Computer Science and Technology, USTC, China. Sep. 2013 ~ Sep. 2014 Visiting Student, MSIS, Rutgers Business School, Rutgers University, USA. Sep. 2006 ~ Jun. 2010 B.S Student, Department of Mathematics, Zhejiang University, China. Major: Information and Computing Science Minor: Public Administration, Cho Kochen Honor College Industrial Experience Aug. 2017 ~ Mar. 2018 Senior Visiting Scholar, Baidu Inc., Beijing, China. Aug. 2011 ~ Dec. 2012 Research Intern, Nokia Research Center GEL, Beijing, China. Mar. 2010 ~ Aug. 2010 Development Engineer, Alibaba Technology Co., Ltd., Hangzhou, China.
